Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was decent produced though, some special effects used to illustrate the action and some incredible work to fake snow for being able to film a couple of wintering scenes. I think it's a pratical source for improving your technical looking.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an example of love it or hate it movie has just as many fans as it does haters. The difference between those two groups of people comes down to one element; is the “hate” a result of understanding how devoid this genre is love and quite simply lacking quality
